hackathon-description-text: For one weekend, PDF:Applied is bringing leading civic “hackers” together with practitioners in government and NGOs to build tools that enhance civic life through technology-driven innovation. Participants will work to build applications that address specific civic needs in keeping with this year’s “Internet is the New Political Power” PDF conference theme.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director of Cloud Computing, Microsoft U.S. Public Sector
Bert G. Kerstetter '66 University Professor of Politics and International Affairs at Princeton University

hackathon-rules: Judges will evaluate apps on the following, equally weighted critiera:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: - Your app showcased at Personal Democracy Forum 2012
- Your app showcased at Personal Democracy Forum 2012
- Your app showcased at Personal Democracy Forum 2012

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: On the areas of election participation, community engagement, or advocacy / activism

hackathon-location-address: 230 West 41st Street, New York, NY 10036, USA
hackathon-description-header: Create an app to enhance our electoral process, help citizens engage in their communities, or help facilitate online activism.
